It depends on the type of application it is to be used. An exmple one 
migh=
t be evolving a structure that minimizes the stress at specified 
area, giv=
en an applied force, etc. Engeneering problems. Or finding 
the material pr=
operties for a given object, that satisfy some 
criteria. In this case only=
 material properties will be evolved, not 
material presence. 
It can also =
be applied to Alife simulations, for creatures with 
internal structure of =
various tissues.. 
I am pointing out that such a system can discover very i=
nteresting 
solutions, not the fitness function itself. There are many fitn=
ess 
functions. 

Peter

uch a system?

> > Hi there, 
> > 
> > I am planning to=
 create an application of CPPNs that generate 3D 
> > tetrahedral meshes to=
 be used in physically-based simulations... 
> The 
> > CPPN will output ma=
terial presence along with material properties 
> like 
> > Young's modulus=
 (elasticity), Poisson's ratio (compressablity), 
> > Density, Plasticity p=
arameters... Then the resulting objects can 
be 
> > simulated in real-time=
 via Finite Element Analysis.. And fitness 
> can be 
> > computed from the=
 results of the simulation.. 
> > It's difficult to discretize the output o=
f the CPPN into finite 
> > elements, so this is the major issue for buildi=
ng such a system.. 
> But 
> > once such a system is built, it has unlimite=
d potential for 
> evolving 
> > any kind of structure...

> > Peter
